scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Wendy
scrape.text: This has to be satire, right? It's all rather ridiculous if taken at face value, but at the same time managed to be more disturbing to me than, say, Gone Girl. While Gone Girls is an all-around far-fetched situation that is unlikely to arise in real life, The Dinner preys on fears we all have about ourselves and our families. The over-the-topness comes from certain moments, not the inherent situation, and matches the over-the-top fancy dinner that frames the story. While I found the read compelling and difficult to put down, in the end things didn't come together as well as I'd hoped.
